book three of the Essene gospel of peace
this third book of the Essene gospel of
peace is a collection of texts of great
spiritual literary philosophical and
poetical value created by two powerful
into woven streams of tradition
chronologically the first is a stream of
tradition to which the Hebrew people
were exposed in the Babylonian prison
dating from the Gilgamesh epic stew the
Zen a vest of zero thew straw the second
is a stream of traditions flowing with
poetical Majesty through the old and new
Testament
dating from the ageless Enoch and the
other patriarchs through the prophets
and on to the mysterious Essene
Brotherhood in the Buried library of the
Essene Brotherhood at the Dead Sea where
the greatest number of scrolls were
found the text of these two streams of
tradition were very much at a woven they
follow each other in a strange
succession the powerful cubistic
simplicity of the first juxtaposed with
the majestic expressionist poetry of the
second the original text of this
collection may be classified into three
approximate groups about 70% of them are
completely different from the ancient
sacred books of the investor's and the
old and new Testament 20% are similar
and 10% are identical my desire in
presenting this collection was to
abstain
drei Phil illogical and exegetical
interpretations and instead to concern
trait on their spiritual and political
values more attractive the 20th century
man I tried to follow the style of my
French translation the first book of the
scene gospel of peace which has now been
published in 17 languages been
distributed in over 200,000 copies I
hope this book 3 will be as successful
as book 1 and thus continue to bring
these ages inspirations to our
disoriented century guiding us per

introduction from the remote ages of
antiquity a remarkable teaching has
existed which is universal and its
application and ageless in its wisdom
fragments of that are found in Sumerian
hieroglyphs and on tiles and stones
dating back some eight or ten thousand
years some of the symbols such as for
the sun moon air water and other natural
forces are from an even earlier age
preceding the Cataclysm that ended the
Pleistocene period how many thousands of
years previous to that the teaching
existed is unknown to study and
practices teaching is to reawaken within
the heart of every man an intuitive
knowledge that can solve his individual
problems in the problem of the world
traces of the teaching have appeared in
almost every country and religion its
fundamental principles were taught in
ancient Persia Egypt India Tibet China
Palestine Greece and many other
countries but it has been transmitted in
its most pure form by the Essene the
mysterious brotherhood which lived
during the last two or three centuries
BC and the first century of the
Christian era at the Dead Sea in
Palestine and at late Marita's in Egypt
in Palestine and Syria the members of
the Brotherhood were known as the scenes
and in Egypt as sariputra or healers the
esoteric part of their teaching is given
in the Tree of Life the Essene communion
with the angels and the Sevenfold peace
among others the exoteric or outer
teachings appear in book one of the
Essene gospel of peace and recently
discovered Dead Sea Scrolls the origin
of the Brotherhood is said to be unknown
and the derivation of the name is
uncertain some believe it comes from
knock or Enoch and claim him to be their
founder their communions with the
angelic word haven't first been given to
him others consider the name comes from
Israel the elects of the people who
Moses brought forth the communions at
Mount Sinai where they were revealed to
him by the angelic world but whatever
their origin it is certain that the
accedes existed for a very long time as
a brotherhood perhaps even under other
names in other lands the teaching
appeared in the then of Vesta of
Zarathustra who translated it into a way
of life that was followed for thousands
of years it contains the fundamental
concepts of brahmanism the Vedas and the
Upanishads and the yoga systems of India
sprang from the same source Buddha later
gave forth essentially the same basic
idea and a sacred bodhi tree is
correlated with the Essene tree of life
in Tibet the teaching wants more found
expression in the Tibetan Wheel of Life
the pythagoreans and Stoics in ancient
Greece also followed the same principles
and much of their way of life the same
teaching was an element of the Adamic
culture of the phoenicians of the
Alexandrian school of philosophy in
Egypt and contributed greatly that many
branches of Western culture free masonry
Gnosticism the Kabala and Christianity
Jesus interpreted it in its most sublime
and beautiful form in the seven
Beatitudes of the sermon of the mount
the Essenes lived on the shores of lakes
and rivers away from cities and towns
and practice a communal way of living
sharing equally and everything they were
mainly agricultural less than Arbor
culturist having a vast knowledge of
crops soil and climatic conditions which
enable them to grow at a remarkable
variety of fruits and vegetables in
comparatively desert areas and with a
minimum of labor
they had no servants or slaves and were
said to have been the first people to
condemn slavery both in theory and
practice there were no rich and no poor
poor among them both conditions being
considered by them as deviation from the
law they established their own economic
system based wholly on the law and
showed that all man's food and material
needs can be attained without struggle
through knowledge of the law they spent
much time instead
both of ancient writings and special
branches of learning such as education
healing and astronomy they were said to
be the heirs of Sheldon and Persian
astronomy and the Egyptian arts of
healing
they were adept in prophecy for which
they prepared by prolonged fasting in
use of plants and herbs for healing man
and beast they were likewise proficient
they lived a simple regular life raising
rising each day before sunrise to study
and commune with the forces of nature
bathing in cold water is a ritual and
donning white garments after their daily
labor in the fields and vineyards they
partook of their meals and silence
preceding and ending them with prayer in
their profound respect for all living
things they never touched flesh foods
nor did they drink fermented liquids
their evenings were devoted to study and
communion with the heavenly forces
evening was the beginning of their day
and their Sabbath or holy day beginning
on Friday evening the first day of their
week this day was given a study
discussion the entertainment of visitors
and the plain of certain musical
instruments relics of which have been
discovered their way of life enabled
them to live to advanced ages of 120
years or more and they were said to have
had marvelous strength and endurance in
all their activities they express
creative love they sent out healers and
teachers from the Brotherhood among them
were Elijah John the Baptist John the
Beloved in the great the seen master
Jesus membership in the Brotherhood was
attainable only after a probationary
period of a year and three years of
initiative work followed by seven more
years before being admitted to the full
inner teaching records of the Essene way
of life have come down to us from the
writing of their contemporaries Pliny
the Roman naturalist Philo the
Alexandrian philosopher Josephus the
Roman historian Salah Gnaeus and others
spoke of them variously as a race by
themselves more remarkable and the other
in the world
the oldest of the initiator sieving
their teaching from Central Asia
teaching perpetuated through an immense
space of ages constant and unalterable
holiness some of the outer teaching is
preserved in Aramaic text in the Vatican
in Rome some in Slovak text was found in
the possession of the Habsburg
Austria and said to have been brought
out of Asia in the 13th century by an
historian priest fleeing the hordes of
King ISKCON echoes of the teaching exist
today in many forms in certain rituals
of the Masonic Order in the symbol of
the seven-branched candlestick in the
greeting peace be with you used from the
time of Moses and even in the seven days
of the week which have long since lost
their original spiritual meaning from
its antiquity its persistence through
the ages it is evident that teaching
could not have been the concept of any
individual or any people but it is the
interpretation by a succession of great
teachers of the law of the universe the
basic law eternal and unchanging as the
stars in their course the same now as
two or ten thousand years ago and as
applicable today as then the teaching
explains the law shows how man's
deviations from it are the cause of all
his troubles and gives the method by
which he can find his way out of his
dilemma the Sevenfold vow I want to and
will do my best to live like The Tree of
Life planted by the great masters of our
Brotherhood with my Heavenly Father who
planted the eternal garden of the
universe and gave me my spirit with my
earthly mother who planted the great
garden of the earth and gave me my body
who my brothers who are working in the
garden of our Brotherhood I want to and
will do my best to hold every morning my
communions with the angels of the
earthly mother and every evening with
the Angels the Heavenly Father has
established by the great masters of our
Brotherhood I want to and will do my
best to follow the path of the Sevenfold
peace I want to and will do my best to
perfect my body with acts my body which
feels and my body which stinks
according to the teachings of the great
masters of our Brotherhood I will always
in everywhere obey with reverence my
master who gives me the light of the
great masters of all time I will submit
to my master and accept his decision on
whatever differences or complaints I may
have against any of my brothers working
in the garden of my Brotherhood and I
shall never take any complaint against a
brother to the outside world
I will always and everywhere keep secret
all the traditions of our Brotherhood
which my master will tell me and I will
never reveal to anyone these secrets
without the permission of my master I
will never claim as my own the knowledge
received from my master and I will
always give credit to him for all his
knowledge I will never use the knowledge
in power I have gained through
initiation from my master from material
or selfish purposes I enter the eternal
and infinite garden with reverence to
the heavenly father to the earthly
mother and to the great masters
reverence to the holy pure and saving
teaching reverence to the Brotherhood of
